job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Zephyrhills, FL
pros: A lot of great residents and floor staff at the AdventHealth Zephyrhills South (Formally Zephyr Haven) nursing home.
cons: Low pay for the work load. Always low staff. They save money by not employing housekeeping so resident living spaces are often filthy. For the amount of money insurance pays residence should be getting better incontinence products, and personal hygiene products. Residents get terrible food as well. Hardly any fresh foods, lots of processed junk from cans. Can't be healthy from terrible diets. DON (Barbie) is very unprofessional. Does not care about staff or residents, only the bottom line. Has intentionally put staff and residents in constant risk via lack of PPE, constantly exposing staff and residents by accepting more covid patients for extra money, improper resident transfers resulting in covid exposures through out building.

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Zephyrhills, FL
pros:
i had everything set up to start monday 10/11, i was cleared to start orientation. Ive payed a heafty deposit on an apartment and moved all my things 2.5hr there today.

 I was out getting groceries for my new apartment after moving, and i get a call saying they are recinding their offer. The recruiter stated it was because "my attitude" didnt meet their company culture?? 

For background, this recruiter gave me the wrong interview day, after giving me the correct one (she change the day from correct to incorrect). I had arrived on the correct day luckily on a hunch (ive had bad experiences with this recruiter before) and the supervisor was super upset the recruiter attempted to change the day. I had informed hr and was told the recruiter got repremanded. Last week, I had asked the recruiter in a email to negotiate pay with me after seeing offer letter as they were well below market comps and my previous salaries, but never heard back. So i signed the letter bc i liked the team, so a pay cut really didnt matter at the end of the day. 
Wensday i was on campus doing premployment and everyone was super nice. after i met my supervisors in my department, and they were also super nice. no indication of problems up until todays phone call from the recruiter.

I texted both supervisors telling them recruitment told me the offer was recinded. And thanked them for their time. Then I called HR, who had no clue my offer was recinded..they have me coming in on monday for orientation still. Hr stated they would reach out to recruiter to figure out what happened, and i havent got a call back yet. Nor an email confirmation saying my offer was recinded. I still show up as hired in the system. So i have to drive to orientation monday to find out if im still employed or not.

So now im possibly out $3500 in moving fees, have to buy myself out of the new apartment for god knows how much, plus $200 wasted in embroidered scrubs i cant use.

Stay away from advent health, the rumors are true, and their recruiter for florida is a petty tyrant. I have contacted lawyers to see if we can sue for lost wages and damages owed.
cons: The recruiter, myesha oliver, needs to get additional education on speaking to applicants

pros: This is a great place to work.
cons: low chance of moving up the ladder.

job_title: RN Nurse Supervisor in Zephyrhills, FL
pros: Our mission is To Extend the Healing Ministry of Christ. Our goals are to treat  all our patients, co-workers, visitors, and community like family. We are encouraged to give our very best to everyone and then go the extra mile. Our CEO Amanda Maggard is amazing! She is openly caring and encouraging and seldom will you see her without a genuine smile. It is not uncommon to see her walking the  halls of the two  hospitals just to visit our staff and share a few moments for impromptu feedback and suggestions.  You never know when that prayer warrior disguised as a CEO will appear at just the right moment. Being a Christian hospital we truly appreciate the fact that our employees serve to do just that- serve. And prayer helps in every situation.
cons: Because we are in an area that has traditionally been rather seasonal the winter parts of the year are quite busy with plenty of time for overtime. Lately the demographics have been  changing to include  increasingly younger and more full time residents. In nearly 3 decades of being part of this work family I have experienced many changes.  If you want a job where you only plan  to expend minimal effort...this is not the place. It takes a team to make a great organization.

review_title: I have worked for AHS for almost 21 years. They encouraged me to move up in my education, Which I did.  I have many grea
job_title: RN Case Manager in Zephyrhills, FL
pros: I am a born again Christian and I am proud to say that I have over the years been able to pray with many patients. I know that God gave me "divine appointments " with many of my patients that I was able to bring comfort just at the right time. Even with family members as well as co-workers. This is what I call being GODS hands on earth. If we just listen, the Holy Spirit will allow us many opportunities to minister to those hurting all around us.
cons: When I tried to think of the cons.....sorry, I wasnt able to come up with any cons....I guess if I have to say one, it might be that a few more $$$ added to the salary...(hourly wage).

pros: Friendly caring staff. Flexible hours. Clean facility. Decent food in lunch room. Room for growth if you brown nose the right people.
cons: Very poor benefits. Radiology director plays favorite to certain employees and talks about one employee to another. She sits in her office and closes the door when staff is slammed with patients. There is no hands on with patients and upper management. On call is very badly paid and it is not an option, it's mandatory. Job is not what I was hired to do, but I'm told to do it or find another job.

pros:
Good pay rates.  Great work "family". Nice environment to work in.
I enjoyed working there except for the dangerous situations they put their nurses in.  I would have stayed if not for that.
cons:
TO MANY PT's per RN--Ratio TO HIGH-No back up-UNSAFE 
Florida Hospital-Zephyrhills force their RN's out due to huge PT loads.
They have lost some great RN's because of this.  TAKE NOTE Admin!
Steer clear of this place fellow RNs.
